connector.description:
Upload data to Azure Storage Files Share.

In the header, you can set the `file` / `ce-file` property to specify the filename to upload. If you do set property in the header, the Kamelet uses the exchange ID as filename.

camel.kamelet.azure-storage-files-sink.a.name: camel.kamelet.azure-storage-files-sink.accountName
camel.kamelet.azure-storage-files-sink.a.description: The Azure Storage Blob account name.

camel.kamelet.azure-storage-files-sink.s.name: camel.kamelet.azure-storage-files-sink.shareName
camel.kamelet.azure-storage-files-sink.s.description: The Azure Storage File Share share name.

camel.kamelet.azure-storage-files-sink.s.name: camel.kamelet.azure-storage-files-sink.sharedKey
camel.kamelet.azure-storage-files-sink.s.description: The Azure Storage Blob access key.

camel.kamelet.azure-storage-files-sink.c.name: camel.kamelet.azure-storage-files-sink.credentialType
camel.kamelet.azure-storage-files-sink.c.description: Determines the credential strategy to adopt.

camel.kamelet.azure-storage-files-sink.d.name: camel.kamelet.azure-storage-files-sink.directoryName
camel.kamelet.azure-storage-files-sink.d.description: The directory from where the producer will upload the file.
